title: Calories in 2 Slices of Bacon
meta_description: Learn calories in 2 slices of bacon, including fat, protein, sodium, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better choices.
assumptions: Standard pork bacon, pan-fried until crisp, drained of excess fat; ~8 g per slice.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, thickness, cooking method, and fat content. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: Two slices of cooked bacon provide ~86 kcal, mostly from fat, with 6 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Switch to turkey bacon per slice
Add 1 tsp maple syrup glaze per slice

faqs.q: How many calories in one slice of bacon?
faqs.a: About 43 kcal for one standard cooked slice.
Yes, two slices have ~384 mg sodium, which is 17% of daily value.

faqs.q: What's the fat content in 2 slices of bacon?
faqs.a: Approximately 6.6 g total fat, including 2.2 g saturated.

faqs.q: Does cooking method affect calories in bacon?
faqs.a: Yes; frying adds more fat than baking or microwaving, increasing calories slightly.

faqs.q: How much protein in 2 slices of bacon?
faqs.a: Around 6 g protein, making it a decent savory snack option.
